image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: A Representative from Missouri; born in Louisville, Ky., January 13, 1934; attended public schools in Bevier, Mo.; B.A., Northeast Missouri State University, 1972; vice chair, Ninth Congressional District Democratic Committee, northeast Missouri, 1970-1972; chair, Macon County Democratic Committee, 1970-1972; district assistant to Representative Jerry L. Litton, 1973-1976; federal co-chair, Ozarks Regional Commission, 1977-1981; member, State senate, 1983-1993; elected as a Democrat to the One Hundred Third and to the three succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1993-January 3, 2001); was not a candidate for reelection to the One Hundred Seventh Congress.

creativeWork.freeFormCitationText: "Patsy Ann Danner" in Women in Congress, 1917-2006. Prepared under the direction of the Committee on House Administration by the Office of History & Preservation, U. S. House of Representatives. Washington: Government Printing Office, 2006.
